list.name: Changes
list.comment: Added run time for when AI play, made some minor esthetic improvements

task.summary: Made a board which randomizes the locations of mines and safe spaces. This initially creates a board with all cells being '-' and then places the specified number of mines into the board. For each non-mine cell, it counts how many of its adjacent cells contain mines and then it stores the count in the corresponding cell.
Testing to see if the git-tracker works

Renamed the class MinesweeperBoard to MinesweeperGame because the new name makes more sense and aligns better with the functionality. I added a new class called MinesweeperAI to separate AI logic from the game logic. This makes the code more modular. Initialization and Setup Initialization Changes: Added Parameters Default parameters for rows, columns, and num_of_mines in MinesweeperGame. Board Initialization:
Previously we had Initialized board and visible_board separately. Currently we have Initializes board, revealed, and flags using list comprehensions. This is to simplify and make the initialization more readable In terms of board generation, I added the function generate_mines to separate the mine generation logic from the board initialization. I added the function count_adjacent_mines to simplify the counting logic to iterate through mine positions directly in order to make the logic more efficient and easier to understand.
I changed the function reveal_cell to make it so it returns false if a mine is hit. Uses a helper function _reveal_recursive to reveal adjacent cells recursively.
The function place_flag now uses a boolean matrix for flags.
Added a clear function (is_victory) to check if the game is won.
I added the class MinesweeperAI One of the function is the heuristic, which calculates the heuristic value for a cell. make_move implements the logic for the AI to make a move. The function expand_frontier expands the frontier by adding adjacent cells in order to encapsulate AI logic and make the code modular and easier to understand.
Made the printing of the table a lot more clean. Fixed grammatical errors. Deleted extra comments we don't need
Added run time for when AI play, made some minor esthetic improvements

MESSAGE.value: Made a board which randomizes the locations of mines and safe spaces. This initially creates a board with all cells being '-' and then places the specified number of mines into the board. For each non-mine cell, it counts how many of its adjacent cells contain mines and then it stores the count in the corresponding cell.
Testing to see if the git-tracker works

Renamed the class MinesweeperBoard to MinesweeperGame because the new name makes more sense and aligns better with the functionality. Previously we had Initialized board and visible_board separately. Currently we have Initializes board, revealed, and flags using list comprehensions. I added the function count_adjacent_mines to simplify the counting logic to iterate through mine positions directly in order to make the logic more efficient and easier to understand.

Added a clear function (is_victory) to check if the game is won.

Made the printing of the table a lot more clean. Fixed grammatical errors. Deleted extra comments we don't need
Added run time for when AI play, made some minor esthetic improvements
